Key Match Events: Slovakia delivered the first major shock result of Euro 2024, snatching an early goal and defending furiously to hold on for a 1-0 victory over Belgium in Group E on Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: Slovakia's win was a major upset in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ivan Schranz scored the winning goal for Slovakia in the 7th minute.
Belgium had 60.4% possession in the match.
Others: The match was played at Deutsche Bank Park in Frankfurt, Germany, with an attendance of 45,181.
